definition[0]: if a soldier, a representative of a country etc gets a posting somewhere, they are sent there to do their job
example[1]: shortly before his posting to South Africa
definition[1]: a message sent to an Internet discussion group so that all members of the group can read it
definition[2]: a public notice, especially one advertising a job
definition[3]: the act of sending a letter, parcel etc through the official delivery system
example[3]: If you do not obtain a certificate of posting we are not legally liable to pay compensation.
definition[4]: the work of entering figures in a LEDGER (=a book or computer record used by a company to record money received or spent)
example[4]: A posting error can be corrected using the correction key.
definition[5]: an occasion when an employee is sent to another country by their employer to do a particular job
example[5]: Mr Gardiner requested, and was granted, a posting to Japan.
example[6]: Postings regarding the company may contribute to volatility in the market price of its stock.
